entry.para: Error
Description
Account cannot be accessed.
You can display the following message to your customers:
Your account cannot be accessed.
Account is not active.
You can display the following message to your customers: Your account is closed.
The spending or receiving limit on the account is exceeded. This error can also occur when the specified bank account has not yet been verified.
The transaction amount is more than the allowed range.
Ensure that you pass an amount within the allowed range. For example, in the U.S. the transaction amount in a Pay operation using a credit card or bank account must be greater than $0.01.
AWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials.
Please make sure that your AWS developer account is signed up for FPS.
A retriable error can happen when two processes try to modify the same data at the same time.
The developer should retry the request if this error is encountered.
A different request associated with this caller reference already exists.
You have used the same caller reference in an earlier request. Ensure that you use unique caller references for every new request.
Even if your earlier request resulted in an error, you should still use a unique caller reference with every request and avoid this error.
Payment instrument is inactive.
The payment instrument is inactive, for example, a credit card has expired.
The transaction could not be completed because the tokens have incompatible payment instructions.
entry.simpara: If any assertion in one of the payment instructions fails, this error is displayed. As such, it may be caused by a number of reasons, for example:

listitem.para: One or more tokens has expired.
The recipient specified in the token is different from the actual recipient in the transaction.
There is violation on the amount restriction.
This token cannot be used with your application as another application has installed it.

entry.para: The external calling application is not the recipient for this postpaid or prepaid instrument. The caller should be the liability holder.
entry.simpara: You are trying to access an instrument that you do not own.

entry.para: The prepaid or the postpaid instrument has expired.
entry.simpara: You must ask your customers to set up a new prepaid or postpaid agreement

entry.para: The sender, caller, or recipientâ€™s account balance has insufficient funds to complete the transaction.
You must ask your customers to fund their accounts. You can then retry this request.

Funding an account can take up to three to four business days using a bank account transfer. This error is also displayed if the party paying the Amazon FPS fees does not have a sufficient account balance.
A retriable error that happens due to some transient problem in the system.
The caller should retry the API call if this error is encountered.
The account is either suspended or closed. Payment instructions cannot be installed on this account.
You must ask your customer to set up a new account if the account is closed.
The developer account cannot participate in the transaction.
Your account is not active. Contact your AWS Representative for more information.
Recipient account cannot participate in the transaction.
You can display the following message to your customer (sender): Your Amazon Payments account is not active. Please visit [insert link to Amazon Payments website] for more details.
Sender account cannot participate in the transaction.
You can display the following message to your customer (sender): Your Amazon Payments account is not active. Please visit [insert link to Amazon Payments website] for more details.
The Caller Reference does not have a token associated with it.
entry.simpara: Use the caller reference value that was passed to the InstallPaymentInstruction operation or the Amazon FPS Co-Branded UI pipeline.

entry.para: The AWS Access Key Id you provided does not exist in our records.
Please check that the AWS Access Key Id used to make the request is valid.
The end date specified is before the start date or the start date is in the future.
One or more parameters in the request is invalid.
For more information, see the parameter descriptions for the action in the API Reference. Parameters are case sensitive.
The payment method used in the transaction is invalid.
The cause for this error is dependent on the calling action:

listitem.para: For InstallPaymentInstruction, payment method specified in the GK construct is invalid.
For FundPrepaid and SettleDebt, the payment method specified in the token is invalid
listitem.simpara: Use a token with payment method specified as any of ABT, ACH, and CC. For Quick accounts, only CC is acceptable. For more information, see .

entry.para: This account cannot receive credit card payments.
entry.simpara: You can display the following message to your customers: You cannot receive credit card payment. Please visit [insert link to Amazon Payments website] to update your account to receive credit card payments.

entry.para: The supplied subscription ID is invalid.
Please ensure that the subscription id passed in the input is correct and is owned by the calling account.
This subscription is already canceled or completed.
None
This token cannot be used for this operation.

Ensure that the account used in this transaction is the same account used in the original transaction. In a refund transaction, the recipient making the refund payment must the be same recipient as in the original transaction.
You did not install the token that you are trying to cancel.
You do not have permission to cancel this token. You can cancel only the tokens that you own.
Retriable: No
The recipient token specified is either invalid or canceled.
You must install a new token if you are the recipient. If you are not the recipient, get a new payment authorization from the recipient.
Retriable: No
The send token specified is either invalid or canceled or the token is not active.
You must ask your customer to set up a new payment authorization.
Retriable: No
An invalid operation was performed on the token, for example, getting the token usage information on a single use token.
Retriable: No
The specified transaction could not be found or the caller did not execute the transaction or this is not a Pay or Reserve call.
Specify the correct the transaction ID.
Retriable: No
The transaction is not complete, or it has temporarily failed.
Specify a duration of more than one hour.
The request is missing a required parameter.
Check that you have specified all the parameters and values required by the action.
entry.simpara: Retriable: After you have provided the complete parameter set.

entry.para: This is not an marketplace application or the caller does not match either the sender or the recipient.
Please check that you are specifying the correct tokens.
The original transaction has failed.
You cannot refund a transaction that has originally failed.
The original transaction is still in progress.
Retry after the original transaction has completed.
The payment method specified in the transaction is not a credit card. You can only use a credit card for this transaction.
entry.simpara: Use only a credit card for this transaction.

entry.para: Payment method is not defined in the transaction.
entry.simpara: Specify the payment method in the sender token.

entry.para: An attempt has been made to fund the prepaid instrument at a level greater than its recharge limit.
entry.simpara: Retriable: Yes, after adjusting the amount of funds to a valid level.

entry.para: The refund amount is more than the refundable amount.
You are not allowed to refund more than the original transaction amount.
The refund was denied.
There are no successful transactions associated with this subscription that can be canceled.
Please wait for a successful payment to be made for this transaction.
The sender and receiver are identical, which is not allowed.
This token is already used in earlier transactions.
entry.simpara: The tokens used in a transaction should be unique.

entry.para: The sender in the refund transaction is not the recipient of the original transaction.
The token you passed as the refund sender token does not belong to the recipient of the original transaction. Pass the correct refund sender token.
The amount being settled or written off is greater than the current debt.
You cannot settle an amount greater than what is owed.
The amount being settled is greater than the reserved amount.
You cannot settle an amount greater than what is reserved.
The request signature calculated by Amazon does not match the signature you provided.
Check your AWS Secret Access Key and signing method.
entry.simpara: For more information, see "Working with Signatures" in the Amazon Flexible Payments Service Getting Started Guide.
For more information, see "Working with Signatures" in the Amazon Simple Pay Advanced User Guide.

entry.para: There was a system error.
The transaction did not complete.
Permission is denied to cancel the token.
You are not allowed to cancel this token.
The token is canceled.
A new token needs to be created.
The recipient token is canceled.
If you are the recipient, set up a new recipient token using the InstallPaymentInstruction operation or direct your customers to the Recipient Token Installation Pipeline to set up recipient token.
The sender token is canceled.
You must ask your customer to set up a new payment authorization because the current authorization is not active.
The token usage limit is exceeded.
entry.simpara: If the usage has exceeded for this period, then wait for the next period before making another transaction. If the usage has exceeded for the entire authorization period, then ask your customer to set up a new payment authorization.

entry.para: This transaction is not allowed.
You are not allowed to do this transaction. Check your credentials.
This transaction has already been completely refunded.
You are not allowed to refund more than the original transaction amount.
You cannot refund this transaction.
Refund is allowed only on the Pay operation.
The recipient's account must have a verified bank account or a credit card before this transaction can be initiated.
You can display the following message to your customer (recipient): Your Amazon Payments account is not active. Please visit [insert link to Amazon Payments website] for more details.
The sender's account must have a verified credit card or a verified bank account before this transaction can be initiated.
You can display the following message to your customers: Please add a credit card or bank account and verify your bank account before making this payment.
A verified bank account should be used for this transaction.
Visit the [insert link to Amazon Payments website] website to verify your bank account.
The caller account must have a verified email address.
You cannot make a web service API call without verifying your email address. Go to [insert link to Amazon Payments website] website and make payments.
The recipient account must have a verified email address for receiving payments.

You can display the following message to your customers: You cannot receive payments. Please verify your email address. Go to [insert link to Amazon Payments website] to verify your account and receive payments.
The sender account must have a verified email address for this payment

You can display the following message to your customers: You cannot receive payments. Please verify your email address. Go to [insert link to Amazon Payments website] to verify your account and receive payments.

section.title: Asynchronous Backend Errors
section.para: The following errors may be returned as the result of an asynchronous transaction initiated by a call to the or actions. Asynchronous errors are contained in the REST response within the GetTransactionResponse/Transaction/ErrorMessage node, and can occur even if the value for the GetTransactionResponse/Transaction/Status node is SUCCESS

note.para: These same codes may be returned within the IPN response, within the errorMessage entry.

entry.para: Error Code and Type
Description and Action
APIs that return this error code
CC
Credit card details are not valid
Ask buyer to verify the credit card details
CC
Amount entered is not valid
Verify if amount specified in request is valid. If amount is entered directly by buyer, prompt buyer to validate the amount.
CC
Credit card account does not exist
Ask buyer to verify the credit card details
ACH
Account number is invalid
Ask buyer to verify bank account details.
ACH
Transaction Amount is not valid
Verify if amount specified in request is valid. If amount is entered directly by buyer, prompt buyer to validate the amount.
ACH
Improper information in one of the mandatory fields
Ask buyer to verify the information entered.
ACH
Check digit in the routing number is not valid
Ask buyer to verify the routing number,
CC
No response from the credit card network
FPS will automatically retry these transactions till the timeout value specified in Pay API.Â Alternatively you can call Cancel API to cancel this transaction.
CC
Credit card network is not reachable
Ask buyer to try at a later stage.
ACH
Receiving bank has limited information for the originating bank
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Receiving bank not qualified to participate in the transaction
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
CC
Buyers' credit card exceeded credit limit
Ask buyer to settle credit card debt and try again.
CC
Card Issuer declined the transaction
Ask buyer to contact the bank. FPS will automatically retry this transaction till the timeout value specified in Pay API. Alternatively you can call Cancel API to cancel this transaction.
CC
Credit card is no longer valid
Ask buyer to contact the issuer.
CC
Backend Payment Processor declined the transaction
Ask buyer to verify the credit card details or contact the issuing bank.
CC
No transactions are allowed on this credit card
Ask buyer to contact the issuing bank.
CC
Backend Payment Processor declined the transaction because of increased buyer activity
Ask buyer to try at a later stage.
CC
Backend Payment Processor declined the transaction without providing any further information
Ask buyer to verify the credit card details or contact the bank.
CC
Card Issuer declined the transaction
Ask buyer to contact the issuing bank.
CC
Card holder has requested a stop on the recurring payment.
Ask buyer to contact the issuing bank.
CC
Credit card account closed
Ask buyer to contact the issuing bank.
CC
Either the credit card has expired or credit card details are incorrect
Ask buyer to verify the credit card details
ACH
Bank Account has been closed
Ask buyer to verify bank account details or contact the bank
ACH
Bank Account does not exist
Ask buyer to verify bank account details or contact the bank.
ACH
Funds available in the Bank Account have been frozen
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Bank Account not eligible for transactions
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Bank Account has insufficient funds to complete the transaction
Ask buyer to add funds to the bank account.
ACH
Account balance insufficient to complete this transaction and pending collections
Ask buyer to add funds to the bank account.
ACH
Stop payment requested on the transaction
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Receiving bank declined the transaction
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Receiving bank found a duplicate entry for this transaction
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Receiving bank declined the transaction
Ask buyer to contact Amazon Payments customer service or representative with the error code/description
ACH
Debit not authorized by receiver
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Receiving bank is not able to settle this transaction
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
ACH Debit not permitted
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
ACH Credit not permitted
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Unauthorized Debit
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
ACH
Transaction declined by the originating bank
Ask buyer to contact the bank.
CC/ACH
Amazon Payments has queued this transaction for manual review
FPS will automatically retry this transaction till the timeout value specified in Pay API. Alternatively you can call Cancel API to cancel this transaction.
CC/ACH
Transaction declined after manual review
CC/ACH
Amazon Payments is not configured to process this request.
Ask buyer to contact Amazon Payments customer service or representative with the error code and error description
CC/ACH
Transaction not successful
Ask buyer to contact Amazon Payments customer service or representative with the error code and error description
